contentrichtext.text: {{multiple issues| {{Notability|products|date=June 2008}} {{Refimprove|date=April 2007}} {{Tone|date=December 2007}} }} The [[Yaesu (brand)|Yaesu]] '''FT-847''' was known as the "Earth Station" according to sales literature<ref>http://www.yaesu.com/downloadFile.cfm?FileID=620&FileCatID=154&FileName=FT%2D847.pdf&FileContentType=application%2Fpdf</ref> and the company's web site.<ref>[http://www.yaesu.com/indexVS.cfm?cmd=DisplayProducts&ProdCatID=102&encProdID=1F9F41E47B926F9590C43C638C5EFD00&DivisionID=65&isArchived=1 Welcome to Yaesu.com<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> Yaesu introduced the FT-847 in 1998 as a replacement for the then discontinued FT-736 VHF/UHF Satellite transceiver, with production ending in 2005.<ref>[http://www.rigpix.com/yaesu/ft847.htm RigPix Database - Yaesu - FT-847<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> The FT-847 is a multimode transceiver providing coverage of all nine [[High frequency|HF]] [[Amateur radio frequency allocations|Amateur bands]] (predating the [[60m band]] allocation), plus [[Very high frequency|VHF]] and [[Ultra high frequency|UHF]] coverage of the 50 MHz ([[6 Meters|6 m]]), 144 MHz ([[2 Meters|2 m]]) and 440 MHz ([[70 centimeters|70 cm]]), with provisions for [[amateur satellite]] operations. == Feature overview == * HF, VHF, and UHF coverage * [[Digital signal processor|DSP]] Filter * Dual Watch * 0.1 Hz Tuning * [[CTCSS]]/[[Digital-Coded Squelch#DCS|DCS]] encode and decode * [[Crossband operation|Cross-band Full Duplex]] * 1200/9600 bit/s Packet Ready == Some specifications == Frequency Range Receive: * 100 kHz–30 MHz * 36–76 MHz * 108–174 MHz * 420–512 MHz Frequency Range Transmit * 160 to 6 m, excluding 60 meters (amateur bands only): 100 W (25 W AM carrier) * 4 m: 50W 70 Mhz With mod. * 2 m: 50 W (12.5 W AM carrier) * 70 cm: 50 W (12.5 W AM carrier) Emission Modes: * USB, LSB, CW, AM, FM, F1 (9600 bit/s Packet), F2 (1200 bit/s Packet), AFSK Remote control with CAT RS232 interface on board At control ==Interesting information== * The FT-847 is a transceiver designed with [[amateur radio satellite]] operation in mind, with features such as cross band full duplex operation, Normal/Reverse Tracking, CTCSS/DCS Encode and Decode and 0.1 Hz tuning steps. * An often overlooked feature of the FT-847 is its four (4) antenna connectors, separating HF, 6 m, 2 m, and 70 cm. ==External links== *[http://rigreference.com/rigs/view/4359/Yaesu_FT_847 Specifications/images/reviews] *[http://www.yaesu.com/ Yaesu's Home Page] *[http://groups.yahoo.com/group/FT847/ FT-847 on Yahoo! Groups ] ==Notes== {{reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Yaesu FT-0847}} [[Category:Amateur radio transceivers]]
